revised_title: Flow Properties of Liquid Helium: A Puzzling Phenomenon
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the flow of liquid helium through capillaries and found that the flow behavior was not consistent with classical fluid dynamics. They discovered that the flow of helium became almost independent of pressure in long, narrow capillaries, suggesting that this might be due to slip on the walls of the capillary. The research aimed to investigate the flow through capillaries of various diameters and lengths to gain a better understanding of the phenomenon.
